channel.title: Can't write data to my external HD
channel.description:
Well.. Sadly I let it drop, while it was on, and it made a weird noise. I picked it up and reconnected it and tried to transfer something... It wasn't writing anything to it and it took a while for a message to pop up saying "the file your trying to copy isn't in that location anymore".. And even after that, sometimes when I try to explore the drive, it says "This folder is empty." yet it still says there's 531mb left of 372gb.
Sometimes when I connect it now, it says the drive is there, other times it doesn't. I just tried copying a txt file and it worked fine but when trying to copy an AVI file (approx. 230mb) it just does that "the file your trying to copy isn't in that location anymore" bit and takes ages to load. (aka freezes my explorer.exe)
halp?

item.title: Can't write data to my external HD
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

Yeah, I niggerigged it into the case ;p

thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Can't write data to my external HD
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Uriko:

I put it in my computer and it actually seems to work fine! I transferred my Weeds episode in a few seconds… the only problem is the SATA cable is about 2 inches long… so I don’t know where I can mount it to keep it in my computer :S

Place it on the bottom of the case. You damaged the converter by the way.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't write data to my external HD
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:3, topic:284197”]What is ‘the head’? :S

edit: I opened it up, and theres the hard drive and then the front part where the usb/plug are connecting into with a circuit board… so I assume that’s the head.

So should I take the hard drive out and actually put it into my computer and see if it works internally?[/quote]
Yes, try it.

Also, head:

item.title: Can't write data to my external HD
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

What is ‘the head’? :S

edit: I opened it up, and theres the hard drive and then the front part where the usb/plug are connecting into with a circuit board… so I assume that’s the head.

So should I take the hard drive out and actually put it into my computer and see if it works internally?

Read full topic
item.source: Can't write data to my external HD

item.title: Can't write data to my external HD
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

You damaged the head or the SATA/IDE -> USB converter. Since it made a noise, I would assume the head.

Read full topic
